titlepage.titleproper: Inventory of the Virginia Taylor McCormick Papers 1887-1953
titlepage.subtitle:
A Collection in the
Manuscripts and Rare Books Department Mss. 65 M13
titlepage.publisher: Earl Gregg Swem Library, College of William and Mary

defitem.label: Funding:
defitem.item: Web version of the finding aid funded in part by a grant from the National Endowment for the Humanities.

archdesc.runner: Special Collections, Earl Gregg Swem Library, College of William and Mary

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, Earl Gregg Swem Library, College of William and Mary
did.unittitle:
Virginia Taylor McCormick Papers,
1887-1953.
did.abstract: Papers, 1887-1953, of Virginia Taylor McCormick, Norfolk, Virginia, poet, literary critic, essayist, lecturer, and editor of The Lyric magazine, 1921-1929. Includes manuscript and printed poems; essays; lectures; and correspondence with other poets and writers.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open to all researchers.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights/Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Before publishing quotations or excerpts from any materials, permission must be obtained from the Curator of Manuscripts and Rare Books, and the holder of the copyright, if not Swem Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Virginia Taylor McCormick Papers, Manuscripts and Rare Books Department, Swem Library, College of William and Mary.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Information
bioghist.p: Virginia Taylor McCormick (1873-1957), of Norfolk, Virginia was a poet, literary critic, essayist, lecturer, and the editor of The Lyric, 1921-1929.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: Papers, 1887-1953, of Virginia Taylor McCormick, Norfolk, Va. poet, literary critic, essayist, lecturer, and editor of The Lyric magazine, 1921-1929. Includes manuscript and printed poems; essays; lectures; and correspondence with other poets and writers. Correspondents include Franklin Pierce Adams, Lady Astor, Lord Beaverbrook, Gamaliel Bradford, Van Wyck Brooks, Walter de la Mare, Ellen Glasgow, Rupert Hughes, Amy Lowell, H. L. Mencken and Marjorie Kinnan Rawlings.

arrangement.head: Organization
arrangement.p: This collection has been organized into 4 series. Series 1 contains manuscript and printed material, Series 2 contains correspondence, Series 3 contains travel diaries, and Series 4 contains clippings, writings, letters and memorabilia.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged into series by material type.

controlaccess.head: Persons:
controlaccess.persname: Astor, Nancy Witcher Langhorne Astor, Viscountess, 1879- 1964.

did.unittitle: Biographical material.

scopecontent.p: Checklist of Virginia Taylor McCormick's writings compiled from the scrapbooks, drafts, and other papers and published works presented to the library. Biographical material relating to Virginia T. McCormick.

c01.head: Series 1: Virginia Taylor McCormick Manuscript and Printed Material

did.unittitle:
Virginia Taylor McCormick manuscript and printed material,
1922-1939.

scopecontent.p: Includes manuscripts, printed poems, essays, lectures, fiction, etc.

did.unittitle: Virginia Taylor McCormick poetry manuscripts: clippings, typescripts, and manuscript poems.

scopecontent.p: Includes a number of poems pasted in a copy of Dramaland by Lin William Price (New York, 1927).

did.unittitle: Virginia Taylor McCormick's lecture notes about literary figures and literature.
Virginia Taylor McCormick's manuscripts and typed drafts of essays, fiction, and lectures.
Printed writings of Virginia Taylor McCormick from The Archive, The Personalist, The Catholic World, The Magnificat, The Westminster Magazine, The Sewanee Review, The Southern Magazine, 1922-1939.

Virginia Taylor McCormick's correspondence,
1922-1953.

Letters to Virginia Taylor McCormick,
1922-1953.

scopecontent.p: The letters are from Lord Beaverbrook, William Bowlin, Gamaliel Bradford, Maude McClare Brown, Van Wyck Brooks, Ralph Tyler Flewelling, R. Grieve, Richard Guggenheimer, Leigh Hanes, Margery Gordon, William C. Huber, Edwin Markham, Frances Mason, Marjorie Kinnan Rawlings, Evelyn Norcross Sherrill, Beverley D. Tucker, Charles Leon Tumasel and others.

did.unittitle:
Letters to Virginia Taylor McCormick from publishers,
1922-1944.

c01.head: Series 3: Virginia Taylor McCormick's Travel Diaries

did.unittitle:
Virginia Taylor McCormick's travel diaries,
1910-1930.
Travel diary, 1 August-30 September 1910.

scopecontent.p: Kept while on trip to Cherbourg, Paris, Strasbourg, Baden-Baden, Neuhausen, Zurich, Lucerne, Interlachen, Luzana, Bellagio, Milan, Genoa, Mozbeaito, Nice, Rome, Naples, Florence, Venice, Innsbruck, Munich, A [?], Salzberg, Vienna, Dresden, Berlin, Amsterdam, Hague, Antwerp, Brussels, Ostend and London.

did.unittitle: Travel diary, 14 February-30 April 1929.

scopecontent.p: Kept while on a Mediterranean cruise which included stops in the Middle East (the Holy Land), Egypt, Basque Provinces, and Paris. She writes down overheard conversations.

did.unittitle: Travel diary, 31 May-29 August 1930.

scopecontent.p: Probably kept by Dr. James Jett McCormick, while on a trip to England and Scotland. Playing golf. Exhibition of Bobby Jones. Tea with Ellen Glasgow. Paul Robeson. Humorous toast to William III. Lord Astor. Stratford-on-Avon. World War I.

c01.head: Series 4: Virginia Taylor McCormick's Scrapbooks of Clippings, Writings, Letters, and Memorabilia

did.unittitle:
Virginia Taylor McCormick's scrapbooks of clippings, writings, letters, and memorabilia,
1887-1942
Virginia Taylor McCormick's clippings, notices of lectures, and book review, ca. 1921 - 1923.
Virginia Taylor McCormick's book reviews, columns in Ledger-Dispatch (called Book Talks), and articles about Virginia Taylor McCormick and The Lyric, 1921-1924.
Virginia Taylor McCormick's poetry clippings, book reviews, articles, fiction and announcements of Virginia Taylor McCormick Voices of the Windand reviews, 1924 - 1926.
Virginia Taylor McCormick's fiction, essays, reviews of Virginia Taylor McCormick's work, poetry clippings, letter to Virginia Taylor McCormick from Will A. Percy, 1926 - 1929.
Virginia Taylor McCormick's poetry clippings and poetry of others.

scopecontent.p: Issues of The Lyric, vol. 6, No. 4 and vol. 8, No. 2.

did.unittitle: Virginia Taylor McCormick's poetry clippings; essays; news clippings, 1930-1938.

scopecontent.p: About Virginia Taylor McCormick; letters by Lady Astor, Mrs. Hayward Wallis, Elkanah E. Taylor, Gamaliel Bradford, R. Torrance, May DeV F. Cobb, Alan Steinbach, Frances R. Williams, Florence Stearns, Mary Brent, Frances Carpenter Huntington, David Morton, and Florence Dickinson Sterns; reviews of the Virginia Taylor McCormick's Radio to Daedalusand Charcoal and Chalk.

did.unittitle: Reviews, clippings and letters concerning Virginia Taylor McCormick's Winter Apple, 1942.

scopecontent.p: letters from Mrs. Robert Baylor Tunstall, Ellen Glasgow, Leigh Hanes, Beverly Tucker, Archibald Rutledge, Mrs. John David Leitch, Julius S. Held, Julia S. Grandy, Colin MacRae, Mrs. Vincent Sheean.

did.unittitle: Miscellaneous clippings collected by Virginia Taylor McCormick (poetry by others); family photographs, clippings by and concerning Virginia Taylor McCormick, (first page dated 1895).

scopecontent.p: Letters are by Edwin Markham, Armistead C. Gordon, Walter de la Mare, H. L. Mencken, Amy Lowell, T. W. Tally, Olive Dargan, Beatrice Ravenel, J. B. Yeats, Caroline Giltinan, Thomas Moult, Galmaliel Bradford, Winifred Russell, Josephine Hammand, Anna Cogswell Wood, Lizette Reese, Margaret V. Smith, Marshall McCormick.
